name: CrossFire
description: CrossFire is a side-scrolling run-and-gun somewhat reminiscent of Contra series, although played at a slower pace. All that is known about the plot is that you are Eric the soldier and you single-handedly fight evil all over the world, from Vietnam to Colombia. You start with your fists and grenades, but soon obtain a sub-machine gun which can be upgraded to spread shot and even to rocket launcher. The upgrades are usually located in breakable crates. Unlike most Contra games, Eric doesn't die in a single hit, but has a lifebar which is partially replenished or extended every time he picks up a weapon upgrade or a medal.

shot.caption: Game's title screen
Round 1 - Vietnam
"Good luck" - they say as you fly to your dangerous mission
In the beginning you punch the enemy to death. Takes just one punch.
Use grenades to blast those out of reach soldiers and turrets
Gacchhhhaaa! Something went wrong...
OK, now that I've got a gun life should be easier
Helicopter boss
Firing with a rocket launcher at a tank apparently stuck in the wall
The helicopter comes to take Eric to the next mission
Round 2 - Praha (Prague, I guess)
You know, I've been playing video games since I can remember myself, and I'm pretty sure I've seen it all -... Wait, what? Submarines in Prague sewers?
Most of these crates are breakable, but you'd want to climb to that weapon upgrade
Submarine boss
Two-shot spread weapon is not very predictable, but at least it's a rocket launcher
That's how Eric ends the day (each mission)
Round 3 - Vladivo (Vladivostok, my home city, apparently)
Hey, it's the only game I know where the action takes place in Vladivostok, and it's just like in real life! Amazing!
Hey, and this flying guy! I meet him every day when I drive to work!
This tank boss is very hard
Further in Vladivostok - destroying some planes
Round 4 - Colombia
Colombian level is a moving train with all sorts of hazards appearing constantly in the background
Rocket launcher should help me stay alive here
Something went wrong during encounter with this helicopter boss
Round 5 - Afghan
Your typical Afghanistan setting
Climbing ladders is a bit tricky in this game
At least they got the Central Asian moon right
Hey, that's the secret weapon of Afghan army - spread shooting Buddhas!
Afghan boss. All the military setting and feel is wasted when you see a fantasy boss like this.
Round 6 - Shatol (I fail to see a geographical match here)
This is some futuristic factory. Apparently they're building an evil super weapon or something
Futuristic tank
This boss looks rather impressive
With agenda like this Eric will never retire
